tweet: Sad to learn of the passing of Richard Overton, whose life peronsified service to our country and local community. Secretary Mattis is a patriot who has served our nation for decades. He is one of the most respected voices on national security issues & his absence will be felt at @DeptofDefense. I extend my appreciation to General Mattis for his career of selfless service to our great nation.

The @PeaceCorps named Texas as one of the top volunteer-producing states in the nation, with 351 Texans currently serving worldwide. Thank you to every Texan who showed an incredible commitment to public service and served our nation in the Peace Corps. #PCTopStates pic.twitter.com/bxnEwYpPmA

In the midst of the holiday season, we must remain vigilant as jihadists remain intent on spreading fear and terror during this time of year. My deepest condolences to the victims & families of the heinous #StrasbourgAttack. We will never waiver in our support to fight terror.

#OTD in 1941, #PearlHarbor was attacked by Japanese naval and air forces. This attack was meant to deter America’s involvement in the Pacific during WWII, but instead, it inspired her Greatest Generation to serve and these heroes leaped into the breach to defend democracy abroad.

Today, on this National Day of Mourning, I hope we listen to President Bush’s words from his Inaugural Address in 1989 and re-engage in our high moral principle to make kinder the face of the nation and gentler the face of the world. #Remembering41

Today’s service at the National Cathedral was a beautiful celebration and noble tribute to the life of George H. W. Bush. I was honored and humbled to be there today and join our nation in saying farewell to the 41st President of the United States. #Bush41 pic.twitter.com/PtQBN8RhQH
